othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Explains how to configure system notifications, email alerts, and event-based triggers to support timely communication across capital-program operations.

body.context: You can display notification messages on the application's login page using the Important Notifications form. The latest published message is displayed on the login screen of the application.

li.p: In the module menu, click Administration.
In the navigation pane, expand Functional Configurations, and then click Important Notifications.
The IMPORTANT NOTIFICATIONS list page is displayed.
The IMPORTANT NOTIFICATIONS page is displayed.
In the Description box, enter the description of the message to be displayed on the login page of the application.

p.note: This information is not published on the login page of the application.

li.p: In the Login Message text box, enter the message to be displayed on the login page of the application.
You can use the various text formatting options to format the information to be displayed.
In the Requested By field, enter the name of the user requesting the message to be displayed.

p.note: This information is not published on the login page of the application.

li.p: From the Requested On drop-down list, select the date of the message request.

p.note: This information is not published on the login page of the application.

li.p: To select the display type of the message, click either of the following options:
Inline - To display the message in the login page.
PopUp - To display the message in a dialog box.
Select the Published check box to publish the message on the application login page.
The latest published message is displayed on the application login page.
